title: 111_s1496
content:
The curr_chunk is about the extension of National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Highway Safety Programs. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act regarding funding for highway safety programs and research. It also includes changes to the Occupant Protection Incentive Grants program. Amendments are made to the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act regarding funding for highway safety programs and research. Changes include increasing appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011 and extending the Safety Belt Performance Grants program until 2011. Amendments to the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act include increased appropriations for highway safety programs for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. The Safety Belt Performance Grants program is extended until 2011. The Alcohol-Impaired Driving Countermeasures Incentive Grant Program under the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act is extended until 2011 with increased appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. The Alcohol-Impaired Driving Countermeasures Incentive Grant Program is extended until 2011 with increased appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, including $139,000,000 for fiscal year 2010 and $69,500,000 for the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011. The National Driver Register and High Visibility Enforcement Program also receive additional funding for the same period. The Motorcyclist Safety program is extended until 2011 with increased appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. The Child Safety and Child Booster Seat Safety Incentive Grants program is also extended. The Motorcyclist Safety program is extended until 2011 with increased appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, including administrative expenses. The Motorcyclist Safety program is extended until 2011 with increased appropriations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, including administrative expenses. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act regarding drug-impaired driving enforcement and older driver safety, extending the applicability of Title 23 until 2011. Extension of the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration program. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration program is extended with amendments to motor carrier safety grants and administrative expenses for fiscal year 2010 and the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act is amended to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal year 2010 and the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011, for various grant programs related to motor carrier safety. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act is amended to allocate funding for fiscal year 2010 and the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011, for grant programs related to motor carrier safety. Amendments include specific funding amounts for high priority activities, new entrant audits, and commercial driver's license information system modernization. Section 4123(d) of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act is amended to allocate $8,000,000 for fiscal year 2010 and $4,000,000 for the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011. Section 4127(e) is also amended to allocate funds to the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration for the same period. Section 4134(c) is amended for the Grant Program for Commercial Motor Vehicle Operators. Section 4134(c) of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act is amended to allocate $500,000 for the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011. Section 4144(d) is also amended for the Motor Carrier Safety Advisory Committee, and Section 4213(d) is amended for the Working Group for Development of Practices and Procedures To Enhance Federal-State Relations. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL EXTENSIONS.

(a) Hazardous Materials Research Projects.--Amends Section 7131(c) of Act (Pub. L. 109-59; 119 Stat. 1910) to extend funding through 2010 and allocate $625,000 for the period October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011.

(b) Dingell Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act.--Amends Section 4(c) of the Act (16 U.S.C. 777c) to extend funding through fiscal year 2010 and allocate funds for the period from October 1, 2010, through March 31, 2011.
